an1.296-305:4.1: “One thing, mendicants, when developed and cultivated, leads solely to disillusionment, fading away, cessation, peace, insight, awakening, and extinguishment.
an1.296-305:4.4: This one thing, when developed and cultivated, leads solely to disillusionment, fading away, cessation, peace, insight, awakening, and extinguishment.”
an1.296-305:6.1: “One thing, mendicants, when developed and cultivated leads solely to disillusionment, fading away, cessation, peace, insight, awakening, and extinguishment.
an1.296-305:6.3: Recollection of the Dharma … Recollection of the Saṅgha … Recollection of ethical conduct … Recollection of generosity … Recollection of the gods … Mindfulness of breathing … Mindfulness of death … Mindfulness of the body … Recollection of peace.
an1.296-305:6.4: This one thing, when developed and cultivated, leads solely to disillusionment, fading away, cessation, peace, insight, awakening, and extinguishment.”
